title: Basic Commands
description: Basic Claude Code CLI commands and operations

commands.name: claude
commands.description: Starts an interactive REPL session, allowing for a back-and-forth conversation with Claude.

commands.name: claude "query"
commands.description: Starts a REPL session with an initial prompt, immediately beginning the conversation with a specific query.

commands.name: claude -p
commands.description: Runs a single, one-off query and prints the response directly to the console without entering interactive mode.

commands.name: claude -c
commands.description: Continues the most recent conversation from your history, picking up right where you left off.

commands.name: claude config
commands.description: Manage local and global configuration settings. Allows you to customize aspects like the UI theme, default model, and other operational parameters. For example, to set the theme to dark globally, use 'claude config set -g theme dark'.

commands.name: claude update
commands.description: Checks for any available updates to the Claude Code CLI and installs them if found, keeping your tool current.

commands.name: claude mcp
commands.description: Configure and manage Multi-Claude Protocol (MCP) servers for advanced, multi-agent workflows.

commands.name: claude migrate-installer
commands.description: Migrates your installation from a global npm package to a local, version-controlled setup.

commands.name: claude doctor
commands.description: Runs a diagnostic check on your Claude Code installation and auto-updater to ensure everything is functioning correctly.

commands.name: pipe | claude
commands.description: Processes content piped from other command-line tools, allowing you to chain commands and pass data to Claude.

commands.name: claude -c -p "query"
commands.description: Continues the most recent conversation non-interactively via the SDK, useful for automated scripts.

commands.name: claude -r "<session-id>"
commands.description: Resumes a specific, previously started session using its unique ID, allowing you to jump back into a past context.
